intro: Townsonia atepala, commonly known as the Mexican rock nettle, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and glandular hairs. The plant typically grows on rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various insects.
